function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of awareness or adherence to hygiene protocols in virtual reality environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate simulation of real-life infectious disease scenarios in virtual reality training","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of virtual reality for healthcare education may not accurately replicate real-world medical scenarios, leading to gaps in knowledge and skills.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption and implementation of virtual reality technology in healthcare education due to infrastructure limitations or resistance to change.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential ethical challenges in the use of virtual reality for medical education, such as privacy concerns and appropriate use of patient data in simulations.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in virtual reality environments due to increased usage and interaction","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of misinformation or incorrect medical training in virtual reality environments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Physical recovery or therapy in virtual reality may not fully replicate real-world outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Connectivity of medical tools and devices through the internet","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accurate forecasting of virus","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Iot devices and healthcare networks can be vulnerable to cyber attacks, leading to unauthorized access and manipulation of critical medical data.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on real-time data and smart device connectivity may lead to errors and misinformation in disease tracking and
